NoteLiteral.En:
Applicants need to attach a copy of ID card/passport (document issued by the country of origin) to enrol for the KTU virtual learning environment. This does not apply to KTU students (if you are a KTU student, you may attach a blank page). 
B2 level of English language proficiency is required.

Description.En:
In today's landscape, a substantial adoption of high-value Artificial Intelligence (AI) use cases is reshaping the ways businesses operate. While some professionals excel as leaders or managers despite lacking technical expertise, others possess formidable technical abilities but lack a deeper understanding of the business context. It is within this juncture that this distance learning micro-module becomes invaluable. 

Designed to bridge the gap between business acumen and technical proficiency, this micro-module is designed for Bachelor and Master students aiming to enhance their expertise in AI applications in business. The micro-module aims to develop competences necessary to leverage AI techniques proficiently, equipping learners with a comprehensive understanding of AI's practical applications and use cases in business. 

The learning outcomes encompass the ability to discern appropriate AI techniques, spanning computer vision, deep neural networks, generative models, machine learning, and more, all tailored to specific business objectives and diverse conditions across human resources, finance, marketing, operations, and inventory management. Learners will also showcase ethical and robust handling of AI's impact on business practices. 

Beyond theoretical knowledge, the micromodule places a strong emphasis on hands-on projects, enabling learners to master essential tools for AI project management, AI-powered financial planning, intelligent process automation, and AI-powered content generation. The micro-module provides interactive, hands-on learning that will make learners not just learn but truly understand and master the subject. 

While this micro-module may not be the perfect fit for individuals already well-versed in AI applications in business, for those seeking to enhance their AI skills and integrate them into diverse business domains, this micro-module provides a unique opportunity for both career growth and educational advancement. Upon completion, learners will emerge with a nuanced understanding of AI and the practical skills necessary to navigate its integration within various business contexts.

Title.En: Comprehensive Understanding of AI for Key Business Functions

PrefLabel.En: evaluate data, information and digital content

NoteLiteral.En: Gain a solid understanding of AI, its applications and use cases across human resource, finance, marketing, operations, and inventory management.

Title.En: Practical Proficiency in AI Techniques for Targeted Business Applications

NoteLiteral.En: Develop the skills necessary to discern AI techniques, including but not limited to computer vision, deep neural networks, machine learning, large language models, and more, for precise business objectives.

Title.En: Command of Ethical and Secure Framework Integration in AI Projects

NoteLiteral.En: Integrate ethical and secure frameworks into AI project planning and decision-making processes to create explainable, responsible, and sustainable AI solutions.

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
This micro-module is PASS or FAIL. To pass the micro-module, you must achieve a score of 50% or higher for each graded activity. The highest possible grade is 100%. When you complete all the required micro-module activities, you will earn a final grade. 

The following weekly activities are weighted out of 100% of the micro-module: 

- 10 % Discussion forum participation

- 30 % Mini projects

- 30 % Micro-module-integrated short activities

- 30 % Tests

The final grade for the micro-module will be calculated as a weighted average of the average grade of each type of activity. 

The learning activities and resources implemented in the micro-module are crafted to facilitate the attainment of anticipated learning outcomes, enabling the acquisition of new knowledge and the development of expected skills and competences. Within this micro-module, you will discover a variety of learning activities and resources. 

Video Lectures / Interactive E-books / Mini Projects / Guided Tutorials / Peer Assessment / Case Studies / Interactive Videos / Online Games / Matching Cards / Crosswords / Drag & Drop / Readings / Discussion Forums / Tests / Feedback / Etc. 

These interactive components collectively aim to reinforce learners' understanding of key concepts, providing a comprehensive and enriching learning experience. Several activities are developed and supported by such acknowledged institutions as Massachusetts Institute of Technology, the UK National Crime Agency, and Queen Mary University of London with support from EPSRC and Google. 

[Syllabus of the micro-module](https://uais.cr.ktu.lt/ktuis/stp_report_ects.mdl_ml?p_kodas=MM00M126&p_year=2024&p_lang=EN&p_stp_id=)
Bridge the gap between business acumen and technical proficiency

AI for Business takes learners on a journey at the intersection of business acumen and cutting-edge technology. This micro-module aims to develop competences necessary to leverage AI techniques proficiently, equipping learners with a comprehensive understanding of AI's practical applications and use cases in business. Elevate your expertise, embrace AI's potential, and position yourself at the forefront of business innovation with the AI for Business micro-module.

Applicants need to attach a copy of ID card/passport (document issued by the country of origin) to enrol for the KTU virtual learning environment. This does not apply to KTU students (if you are a KTU student, you may attach a blank page). 

B2 level of English language proficiency is required.
